ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Heritrix(-63)-Prerequisite unschedulable failure
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Gordon, Thanks for your detailed explaination. I can see your point that adding PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule never hurts because it doesn t have any

Hi Gordon,

Thanks for your detailed explaination.

I can see your point that adding
PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule never hurts because it
doesn't have any "opinion" on anything excepted it
ACCEPTs the last hop with a P notation.

The only thing confuse me now is that how come the
decision of the following chain is REJECT:
- RejectDecideRule
-
OnDomainsDecideRule(decision=Accept,seeds-as-surt-prefixes=true)

I can understand that it might fail on CrawlURI with a
different domain.  But when I run Heritrix, it doesn't
even crawl the page of the seed.

Probably I misunderstand something?

Thanks in advance.


Cheers,
Hei

--- Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:

> Hei Chan wrote:
> > Hi Bjarne,
> > 
> > Thanks for your time.
> > 
> > Are you saying that RejectDecideRule actually
> > dis-allow DNS-lookup and fetching robots.txt?
> > 
> > If I put PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule right after
> > RejctDecideRule, the *only* effect will be
> allowing
> > Heritrix to do DNS-lookup and fetching robots.txt?
> 
> RejectDecideRule REJECTs everything -- it is used to
> establish the 
> default decision. It is then up to later rules to
> ACCEPT what you want 
> and what is necessary for proper crawler
> functioning.
> 
> PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule ACCEPTs all URIs that
> have been reached via 
> a 'P'-notated hop. (That is, the last character in
> the 'hops-path' is 
> 'P'.) The only URIs so notated are DNS and robots
> URIs that were 
> scheduled as necessary prerequisites of other URIs.
> 
> Sometimes PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule is
> unnecessary (because perhaps 
> all necessary URIs are already being accepted by
> other rules), but it 
> never hurts.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> > Thanks in advance.
> > 
> > Cheers,
> > Hei
> > --- Bjarne Andersen <bja@...>
> wrote:
> > 
> >> You can't crawl anything if not allowing
> DNS-lookup
> >> and fetching of robots.txt. This is exactly what
> >> PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule does.
> >>
> >> best
> >> -- 
> >> Bjarne Andersen

> >>>>> Oops forgot to provide more info about my
> >> setting:
> >>>>> DecidingScope:
> >>>>> - RejectDecideRule()
> >>>>> -
> >
>
OnDomainsDecideRule(decision=Accept,seeds-as-surt-prefixes=true)
> >>>
> >>>
> >>> I am sure someone can give a reason for why this
> >> is needed but try 
> >>> adding this decide rule to the end of your
> chain: 
> >>> PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule
> >>>
> >>> It worked for me...
> >>>
